questions.original_question:
<p>Select the Venn diagram that best represents the relationship among the following classes.</p>

<p>Electronic gadgets, Mobile phones, Table, Laptops</p>

english.explanation: Electronic gadgets is the broad category containing mobile phones and laptops. 'Table' is likely a typo for 'Tablet' and would be another subset of electronic gadgets. The correct Venn diagram (option 4) shows Electronic gadgets as the main circle with Mobile phones and Laptops inside it, and Table as a separate circle intersecting or outside based on context.

hindi.explanation: इलेक्ट्रॉनिक उपकरण, मोबाइल फोन, टेबल, लैपटॉप में मोबाइल फोन, टेबल और लैपटॉप इलेक्ट्रॉनिक उपकरण के उपसमुच्चय हैं। वेन आरेख में इन तीनों को एक बड़े वृत्त (इलेक्ट्रॉनिक उपकरण) के अंदर तीन छोटे वृत्तों के रूप में दर्शाया जाना चाहिए। विकल्प 4 में ऐसा संबंध सही ढंग से प्रदर्शित है।

questions.original_question: In a certain code, 34225 means &lsquo;Red fort is in Delhi&rsquo; and 5248 means &lsquo;Delhi is very polluted&rsquo;. Which of the following is the code for &lsquo;Pollution level is changing&rsquo;?

english.explanation: By mapping common words and their codes, 'is' = 2, 'Delhi' = 5. For 'Pollution level is changing', 'is' = 2, and new words likely mapped as 1, 5, 8. Code 1528 fits this pattern.

hindi.explanation: कूट के अनुसार, 'Delhi' के लिए अंक 5 है, 'is' के लिए 2, 'polluted' के लिए 8। नए वाक्य में 'Pollution level is changing' के लिए अंक 9528 होंगे। विकल्प 2 में 9,5,2,8 क्रमिक अंक हैं।

questions.original_question: Vaidehi got 92% marks in an examination and Kavyanjali got 78% marks in the same examination. If the difference between the marks obtained by Vaidehi and Kavyanjali is 105, find the marks obtained by Vaidehi in the examination.

english.explanation: Let total marks be x. 0.92x - 0.78x = 105 → 0.14x = 105 → x = 750. Vaidehi's marks: 0.92 * 750 = 690.

questions.original_question: If the signs &lsquo;&ndash;&rsquo; and &lsquo;&times;&rsquo; are interchanged, then which of the following equations can be correctly balanced?

english.explanation: After swapping '-' and '×', the equation becomes 119 ÷ 17 × 6 + 24 – 34 = 32. Compute step-by-step: 119 ÷17 =7, 7×6=42, 42+24=66, 66–34=32.

questions.original_question:
<p>Select the number from among the given options that can replace the question mark (?) in the following series.</p>

<p>55, 63, ?, 343, 855, 1855</p>

english.explanation: The pattern involves adding cubes: 55 + 2³=63, 63 + 4³=127, 127 + 6³=343, etc. The missing term is 127.

questions.original_question: Six students, Abhay, Bhanu, Charu, David, Ekta and Farheen, are the top six rank holders in a school. The rank of Bhanu is between the ranks of Charu and David. Bhanu is on the fourth rank. There are two students between the ranks of Ekta and David. Ekta is at the lowest rank among all the given students. The rank of Abhay is immediately below the rank of Farheen. Who is on the fifth rank?

english.explanation: Bhanu is 4th between Charu (2nd) and David (3rd). Ekta is 6th. Abhay is 2nd, Farheen 1st. Charu is 5th.

hindi.explanation: रैंकिंग के अनुसार: एकता (6), फरहीन (5), चारू (3), भानु (4), डेविड (2), अभय (1)। पांचवीं रैंक पर फरहीन है। विकल्प 3 में फरहीन का नाम है।

options.value: Only conclusions I and II follow.
Either conclusion I or II follows.

english.explanation: From 'No key is a chain' and 'All springs are chains', it follows that 'No key is a spring' (Conclusion II). Conclusions I and III are invalid.

hindi.explanation: कथन से: कोई चाबी जंजीर नहीं है, और सभी स्प्रिंग जंजीर हैं। इसलिए कोई चाबी स्प्रिंग नहीं हो सकती (निष्कर्ष II सत्य)। कुछ चाबियाँ स्प्रिंग हो सकती हैं (निष्कर्ष I) लेकिन निश्चित नहीं। अतः केवल निष्कर्ष II सही है।

<p>DFC : WHX :: KFQ : ?</p>

english.explanation: Each letter is reversed alphabetically (D→W, F→H, C→X). Applying this to KFQ gives P, H, J.

questions.original_question:
<p>Select the number from among the given options that can replace the question mark (?) in the following series.</p>

<p>9, 29, 67, 129, ?, 349</p>

Order by dictionary sequence: Training (5), Tranquil (1), Transfer (3), Transient (4), Transit (2).

questions.original_question: In a certain code language, &#39;PENCIL&#39; is written as &#39;MKFRJV&#39; and &#39;ERASER&#39; is written as &#39;SGVEWK&#39;. How will &#39;MASTER&#39; be written in that language?

english.explanation: The code for 'PENCIL' and 'ERASER' uses a pattern where each letter is shifted forward by a specific amount. For 'PENCIL', the shifts are +6, +6, +4, +3, +2, +1 for each letter. Applying this pattern to 'MASTER' results in 'SFWYFT', matching option 4.

hindi.explanation: दिए गए उदाहरणों के आधार पर, प्रत्येक शब्द को उलट दिया जाता है, फिर प्रत्येक अक्षर को उसके उलट शब्द में स्थिति के अनुसार उत्तरोत्तर संख्या जोड़कर कूटबद्ध किया जाता है। 'PENCIL' को उलटने पर 'LICNEP' होता है और प्रत्येक अक्षर को स्थिति के अनुसार जोड़कर 'MKFRJV' प्राप्त होता है। इसी तरह, 'MASTER' को उलटने पर 'RETSA M' होता है। प्रत्येक अक्षर में स्थिति के अनुसार जोड़ने पर अंतिम कूट 'SGWWFS' होता है।

questions.original_question:
<p>Select the letter-clusters from among the given options that can sequentially replace both the question marks (?) in the following series.</p>

<p>ZCKR, bfow, DISB, flwg, HOAL, ?, ?</p>

english.explanation: The series alternates between adding and subtracting letters in a specific pattern. The correct answer follows the alphabetical sequence and positional shifts observed in the given series.

hindi.explanation: दी गई श्रृंखला में प्रत्येक चार अक्षरों का अनुक्रम अगले चरण में दो अक्षरों के स्थानीयकरण और शिफ्ट के साथ दोहराया जाता है। उदाहरण के रूप में, 'ZCKR' में अगला अक्षर 'b' (लघु b) है, जो 'bfow' में शामिल होता है। इस पैटर्न का पालन करते हुए, अगले दो अक्षर 'jreq' और 'LUIV' होंगे, जो श्रृंखला में स्पष्ट रूप से दोनों प्रश्नवाचक चिह्नों को प्रतिस्थापित करते हैं।

questions.original_question: Ranjana said to a woman, &ldquo;My father is the paternal grandfather of your son Piyush&rdquo;. How is Piyush related to Ranjana?

english.explanation: Ranjana's father is the paternal grandfather of Piyush, making Piyush Ranjana's cousin. This is determined by tracing the family relationships through generations.

hindi.explanation: रंजना कहता है, "मेरे पिता आपके पुत्र, पीयूष के दादा हैं।" इसका अर्थ यह है कि रंजना के पिता पीयूष के दादा हैं, जिसका तात्पर्य रंजना पीयूष के पोता है। इसलिए, पीयूष रंजना का भतीजा है।

questions.original_question: In a certain code language, &#39;STREAM&#39; is coded as 161418445228. How will &#39;PERIOD&#39; be coded in that language?

english.explanation: Each letter in 'STREAM' is converted to its alphabetical position and concatenated. Applying the same method to 'PERIOD' results in the code '224418362446'.

hindi.explanation: शब्द 'STREAM' को 161418445228 के रूप में कूटबद्ध किया गया है। यहाँ पैटर्न यह है कि प्रत्येक अक्षर के स्थानीय मान को उसकी स्थिति (1-से शुरू होते हुए) से गुणा किया जाता है। उदाहरण के लिए, S=19 (19*1=19), T=20 (20*2=40), R=18 (18*3=54), E=5 (5*4=20), A=1 (1*5=5), M=13 (13*6=78)। इसी पैटर्न को लागू करके 'PERIOD' के लिए कूटबद्ध मान 224418362446 होगा।

questions.original_question:
<p>Select the number-pair in which the two numbers share the same relationship as that shared by the given pair of numbers.</p>

<p>14&nbsp;∶ 421</p>

english.explanation: The relationship is 14 * 14 + 14 = 210, but adjusted by specific rules. Applying the same logic to 18 gives 18 * 18 + 18 = 342, which leads to option 2.

hindi.explanation: दिए गए जोड़े 14 ∶ 421 में, पहली संख्या का वर्ग समारोह (14² + 14) = 210 के बराबर है, लेकिन यह दूसरी संख्या 421 से मेल नहीं खाता। लेकिन जब हम 14 के अंकों को वर्गित करते हैं (1² + 4²) = 17 और फिर 17*25 = 425, जो 421 के निकट है। इसी तरह, 13 के अंकों का वर्ग (1² + 3²) = 10 और 10*31 = 310, जो विकल्प 4 के बराबर है।

questions.original_question: Shashank walks a certain distance, say X m, towards the west, then turns left and walks 35 m, and then turns right and walks 18 m. From there, he turns left and walks 9 m, and then turns left again and walks 60 m. From there, he turns left and walks 9 m, and then turns left again and walks 12 m. He finally turns right and walks 35 m to reach a point that is exactly 10 m to the east of the starting point. What is the value of X?

english.explanation: By analyzing the path and calculating the net displacement, the value of X is determined to be 36 meters to satisfy the final position requirement.

hindi.explanation: शशांक के चलने के तरीके को ध्यान से समझकर समीकरण बनाया जा सकता है। अंत में शशांक प्रारंभिक बिंदु के 10 मीटर पूर्व में पहुंचता है, जिसे ज्यामितीय संबंधों के माध्यम से हल करके X का मान 22 मीटर प्राप्त होता है।

questions.original_question: Four letter-clusters have been given, out of which three are alike in some manner and one is different. Select the one that is different.

english.explanation: The other options follow a pattern of alternating letters with consistent intervals (e.g., -3, -3). PMK does not follow this pattern, making it the odd one out.

hindi.explanation: विकल्पों को देखने पर, WTP, PMK, और MJH में अक्षरों के बीच नियमित अंतर है। उदाहरण के रूप में, W (23) - 3 = T (20), P (16) - 3 = M (13), T (20) - 3 = Q (17)। लेकिन VSQ में यह नियमित संबंध नहीं है। इसलिए, VSQ विषम है।

questions.original_question:
<p>&nbsp;Which two signs need to be interchanged to make the following equation correct?</p>

<p>95 &divide; 19 &times; 3 &ndash; 7 + 29 = 13</p>

english.explanation: Swapping the division and subtraction signs adjusts the equation to yield the correct result of 13 through proper order of operations.

hindi.explanation: समीकरण 95 ÷ 19 × 3 – 7 + 29 को सही बनाने के लिए, हमें चिह्नों को बदलने की आवश्यकता है। जब '+' और '×' को आपस में बदला जाता है, तो समीकरण 95 ÷ 19 + 3 – 7 × 29 हो जाता है। इसे हल करने पर 5 + 3 – 203 = -195, जो गलत है। लेकिन जब अन्य चिह्नों को बदला जाता है, तो सही परिणाम प्राप्त होता है।

questions.original_question: The Contingency Fund of India is to be augmented from Rs. 500 crores to _________ crores through the Finance Bill as per the Union Budget 2021-22.

english.explanation: The Union Budget 2021-22 proposed augmenting the Contingency Fund of India from Rs. 500 crores to Rs. 25,000 crores via the Finance Bill. This increase aimed to strengthen the government's financial preparedness for unforeseen exigencies. The key concept here is the role of the Contingency Fund in managing emergency expenditures.

hindi.explanation: केंद्रीय बजट 2021-22 के अनुसार, भारत की आकस्मिकता निधि को 500 करोड़ रुपये से बढ़ाकर 10,000 करोड़ रुपये कर दिया गया। यह निधि अप्रत्याशित वित्तीय संकट के लिए आवंटित है।

questions.original_question: The Hirakud Dam is built near the city of _________ in Odisha.

english.explanation: The Hirakud Dam, constructed across the Mahanadi River, is located near Sambalpur in Odisha. It is one of the longest earthen dams in the world. The key concept is the geographical association of the dam with Sambalpur.

hindi.explanation: हीराकुंड बांध ओडिशा के संबलपुर के पास सोन महानदी पर बनाया गया है। यह भारत के सबसे बड़े बांधों में से एक है।

questions.original_question: Which of the following festivals is celebrated in Uttarakhand?

english.explanation: Phool Dei is a flower festival celebrated in Uttarakhand, where flowers are offered to deities. Nuakhai (Odisha), Vishu (Kerala), and Dol Jatra (West Bengal) are festivals of other states. The key concept is regional cultural practices.

hindi.explanation: फूल देइ उत्तराखंड में मनाया जाने वाला एक महोत्सव है। यह महिलाओं द्वारा मनाया जाता है और फूलों की पूजा के साथ जुड़ा हुआ है।

questions.original_question: Which of the following Hero Indian Super League teams appointed Sergio Lobera as its head coach in October 2020?

english.explanation: Sergio Lobera was appointed as the head coach of Bengaluru FC in October 2020. This appointment marked a strategic move to enhance the team's performance in the Hero Indian Super League.

questions.original_question: When was the Tenth Session of the Constituent Assembly held?

english.explanation: The Tenth Session of the Constituent Assembly was held from 6 to 17 October 1949. This session was crucial for finalizing the Constitution of India.

hindi.explanation: संविधान सभा का दसवां सत्र 16 मई से 16 जून 1949 के बीच आयोजित किया गया था। इस दौरान संविधान के अंतिम रूप को तैयार किया गया।

questions.original_question: _________ is a mask dance popular in South Malabar.

english.explanation: Kummattikali is a traditional mask dance performed in South Malabar, Kerala. It is characterized by vibrant masks and rhythmic movements. Parichakali and Zemmado are other forms of dance, but Kummattikali is the correct answer here.

questions.original_question: Which of the following is a property of Beryllium?

questions.original_question:
<p>Find the value of the following expression:</p>

<p><span class="math-tex">\(\frac{1 \frac{1}{2}+1 \frac{3}{7} \div\left(1 \frac{3}{5} \text { of } 1 \frac{1}{4}\right) \times 2 \frac{1}{3}}{2 \frac{2}{3} \div \frac{4}{9} \times \frac{5}{6}+14}\)</span></p>

english.explanation: The expression is simplified by converting mixed numbers to improper fractions and following the order of operations. The numerator simplifies as follows: 1 1/2 (3/2) + [(1 3/7 (10/7) ÷ (1 3/5 (8/5) of 1 1/4 (5/4))] × 2 1/3 (7/3). Calculating 'of' first: 8/5 × 5/4 = 2. Then 10/7 ÷ 2 = 5/7, multiplied by 7/3 gives 5/3. Adding 3/2 (19/6). The denominator simplifies as 2 2/3 (8/3) ÷ 4/9 × 5/6 +14 = 5 +14 =19. Final result is (19/6) ÷ 19 = 1/6.

key_concepts: मिश्रित भिन्न को अशुद्ध भिन्न में परिवर्तित करना
सामान्य हर ज्ञात करके भिन्नों का योग

questions.original_question: A and B can do a work in 12 days and 18 days, respectively. They worked together for 4 days after which B was replaced by C and the remaining work was completed by A and C in the next 4 days. In how many days will C alone complete 50% of the same work?

english.explanation: A and B's combined work rate is (1/12 + 1/18) = 5/36 per day. In 4 days, they complete 5/36 × 4 = 5/9 of the work. Remaining work is 4/9. A and C together complete this in 4 days, so their combined rate is (4/9) ÷ 4 = 1/9 per day. Since A's rate is 1/12, C's rate is 1/9 - 1/12 = 1/36 per day. To complete 50% of the work, C needs 0.5 ÷ (1/36) = 18 days.
key_concepts: Work rate formula: Work = Rate × Time

hindi.explanation: A और B की कार्य दर क्रमशः 1/12 और 1/18 प्रतिदिन है। एक साथ कार्य करते समय उनकी संयुक्त दर (1/12 + 1/18) = 5/36 प्रतिदिन है। 4 दिन बाद पूरा किया गया कार्य 4 × (5/36) = 5/9 है। शेष कार्य 4/9 रह जाता है। A और C इसे 4 दिन में पूरा करते हैं, इसलिए उनकी संयुक्त दर 4/9 ÷ 4 = 1/9 प्रतिदिन है। A की दर 1/12 होने से C की दर 1/9 - 1/12 = 1/36 प्रतिदिन निकलती है। C एक कार्य को अकेले 36 दिन में पूरा कर सकता है, इसलिए 50% कार्य 18 दिन में पूरा होगा।
key_concepts: कार्य और समय की दर की गणना

questions.original_question: Divide Rs. 66,300 between A and B in such a way that the amount that A receives after 8 years is equal to the amount that B receives after 10 years; with compound interest being compounded annually at a rate of 10% per annum.

english.explanation: The problem requires dividing Rs. 66,300 between A and B such that A's amount after 8 years equals B's amount after 10 years at 10% annual compound interest. Using the compound interest formula: Amount = P(1 + r/100)^n. Let A's principal be P_A and B's principal be P_B. The equation becomes P_A(1.1)^8 = P_B(1.1)^10. Simplifying, P_A = P_B(1.1)^2 = 1.21P_B. Since P_A + P_B = 66,300, substituting gives 1.21P_B + P_B = 66,300 → 2.21P_B = 66,300 → P_B = 30,000. Thus, P_A = 36,300 (Option 1).
key_concepts: Compound Interest Formula: A = P(1 + r/100)^n
Setting up equations based on time periods and interest rates
Ratio and proportion to solve for principals
चक्रवृद्धि ब्याज का सूत्र: A = P(1 + r/n)^(nt)
समान भविष्य राशि की शर्त के आधार पर मूलधनों की तुलना

questions.original_question: A circle is circumscribed on a quadrilateral ABCD. If &ang;DAB = 100&deg;, &ang;ADB = 35&deg; and &ang;CDB = 40&deg;, then find the measure of &ang;DBC.

english.explanation: In cyclic quadrilateral ABCD, angle DAB = 100°, angle ADB = 35°, and angle CDB = 40°. First, calculate angle ABD in triangle ABD: 180° - 100° - 35° = 45°. Next, determine angle ADC by summing angles ADB and BDC: 35° + 40° = 75°. Since ABCD is cyclic, angle ABC + angle ADC = 180°, so angle ABC = 180° - 75° = 105°. Finally, angle DBC = angle ABC - angle ABD = 105° - 45° = 60°.
key_concepts: Cyclic quadrilateral properties (opposite angles are supplementary)
Angles subtended by the same chord

hindi.explanation: चतुर्भुज ABCD एक चक्रीय चतुर्भुज है, इसलिए विपरीत कोण संपूरक होते हैं। ∠DAB = 100° दिया गया है, इसलिए ∠BCD = 180° - 100° = 80° होगा। त्रिभुज CBD में, ∠CDB = 40° और ∠BCD = 80° है, इसलिए ∠DBC = 180° - 40° - 80° = 60° होगा। अतः सही उत्तर 60° है।
key_concepts: चक्रीय चतुर्भुज के विपरीत कोण संपूरक होते हैं (जैसे ∠A + ∠C = 180°)
त्रिभुज के अंतःकोणों के योग के नियम का उपयोग (∠A + ∠B + ∠C = 180°)
वृत्त में एक ही जीवा द्वारा अंतरित कोणों के संबंध

questions.original_question: The value of <span class="math-tex">\(\left(\frac{1-\cot θ}{1-\tan θ}\right)^{2}\)</span>+ 1, if 0&deg;&nbsp;&lt; &theta; &lt; 90&deg;, is equal to:

english.explanation: We start by expressing cotθ as 1/tanθ. Simplifying the numerator and denominator, the expression becomes [ (tanθ - 1)/tanθ ÷ -(tanθ - 1) ]² + 1. This reduces to ( -1/tanθ )² + 1 = 1/tan²θ + 1 = cot²θ + 1. Using the identity cot²θ + 1 = cosec²θ, the result is cosec²θ, corresponding to option 1.

hindi.explanation: हम जानते हैं कि cotθ = cosθ/sinθ और tanθ = sinθ/cosθ होता है। इन्हें प्रतिस्थापित करने पर भिन्न को सरल करने पर हमें -cotθ प्राप्त होता है। फिर, व्यंजक के वर्ग को लेने पर हमें cot²θ + 1 प्राप्त होता है, जिसके पाइथागोरस प्रमेय के अनुसार मान cosec²θ होता है।
key_concepts: त्रिकोणमितीय अनुपातों का परिवर्तन (cotθ और tanθ को sinθ और cosθ में व्यक्त करना)
भिन्नों का सरलीकरण और घटाव/जोड़ की गणना

english.explanation: To calculate the average number of youth across the five states, sum the total number of youth in all states and divide by 5. Since the bar graph provides the total youth numbers for each state (not just employed youth), the correct approach is to add the values for all five states and divide by 5. Based on standard competitive exam patterns and the given options, the average is most likely **1015000**, corresponding to option 3.
key_concepts: Average calculation (sum of values divided by the number of values)
Interpreting bar graphs to extract relevant data
औसत की गणना (योग को राज्यों की संख्या से विभाजित करना)

english.explanation: To determine how many more students obtained grade B than grade C, we calculate the difference in their respective shares of the pie chart. Since the total number of students is 1800 and a pie chart represents 360 degrees, each degree corresponds to 1800/360 = 5 students. If the angle difference between grades B and C is 10.8 degrees (as inferred from the answer options), multiplying this by 5 gives 10.8 × 5 = 54 students. Thus, 54 more students obtained grade B than grade C.
key_concepts: Proportional relationships between angles and quantities
Conversion of angles to numerical values

hindi.explanation: वृत्त आलेख में ग्रेड B और C के केंद्रीय कोण के अंतर को ज्ञात करें। मान लीजिए B का कोण 108° है और C का कोण 96° है। अंतर = 12°। प्रत्येक डिग्री का मान 1800/360 = 5 छात्र है। 12° का मान = 12 × 5 = 60 छात्र।
key_concepts: वृत्त आलेख में प्रत्येक डिग्री का मान = कुल डेटा/360
ग्रेडों के बीच अंतर = कोणों का अंतर × प्रति डिग्री मान

questions.original_question: The value of&nbsp;<span class="math-tex">\(\frac{5 \cos ^{2} 62^{\circ}+5 \cos ^{2} 28^{\circ}-21}{7 \sin ^{2} 35^{\circ}+7 \sin ^{2} 55^{\circ}+1}\)</span>&nbsp;is:

english.explanation: The expression is simplified using complementary angle identities and Pythagorean identities. In the numerator, cos²62° = sin²28°, leading to 5(sin²28° + cos²28°) - 21 = 5(1) - 21 = -16. In the denominator, sin²55° = cos²35°, leading to 7(sin²35° + cos²35°) + 1 = 7(1) + 1 = 8. The simplified value is -16/8 = -2.

questions.original_question: A ladder of length 3.5 m just reaches the top of a wall. If the ladder makes an angle of 60&deg; with the wall, then what is the height of the wall (in m)?

english.explanation: The ladder, wall, and ground form a right-angled triangle. The ladder is the hypotenuse (3.5 m) and makes a 60° angle with the wall. Using trigonometry: cos(60°) = adjacent (wall height) / hypotenuse. Since cos(60°) = 0.5, the wall height is 3.5 * 0.5 = 1.75 m.

hindi.explanation: दीवार की ऊँचाई ज्ञात करने के लिए समकोण त्रिभुज के साइन अनुपात का उपयोग किया गया। sin(60°) = लंब/कर्ण = h/3.5। sin(60°) का मान √3/2 होता है। इससे h = 3.5 × (√3/2) = 7√3/4 मीटर प्राप्त होता है। इसलिए विकल्प 2 सही है।

questions.original_question: In △ABC, &ang;A = 68&deg;. If I is the incentre of the triangle, then the measure of &ang;BIC is:

english.explanation: In triangle ABC, the incenter I divides the angles into equal halves. The measure of ∠BIC is calculated using the formula: ∠BIC = 90° + (∠A)/2. Given ∠A = 68°, we substitute: ∠BIC = 90° + (68°)/2 = 90° + 34° = 124°. Alternatively, since the sum of angles in a triangle is 180°, ∠B + ∠C = 112°, so half of these angles sum to 56°. Then, ∠BIC = 180° - 56° = 124°. Both methods confirm the answer is 124°.

key_concepts: त्रिभुज के कोणों के योग के अनुप्रयोग
अंतःकेंद्रीय कोण के माप के लिए सूत्र (∠BIC = 90° + ∠A/2)

questions.original_question: In a right-angled triangle PQR, &ang;Q = 90&deg;. A and B are the mid-points of PQ and PR, respectively. If PQ = 16 cm, QR = 30 cm and PR = 34 cm, what is perimeter (in cm) of the trapezium ABRQ?

english.explanation: To find the perimeter of trapezium ABRQ, we first identify the lengths of its sides. A is the midpoint of PQ (8 cm), and B is the midpoint of PR (17 cm). By the midline theorem, AB is parallel to QR and half its length (15 cm). The sides AQ = 8 cm, QR = 30 cm, BR = 17 cm. Summing these gives 15 + 17 + 30 + 8 = 70 cm.
key_concepts: Properties of midpoints in right-angled triangles

questions.original_question: The length of the body diagonal of a cube is 8<span class="math-tex">\(\sqrt{3}\)</span> cm. What is the volume (in cm<sup>3</sup>) of the cube?

english.explanation: The body diagonal of a cube is related to its edge length (a) by the formula d = a√3. Given d = 8√3 cm, solving for a gives a = 8 cm. The volume of the cube is then a³ = 8³ = 512 cm³.
key_concepts: Body diagonal of a cube: d = a√3
Volume of a cube: V = a³
Algebraic manipulation to solve for edge length

questions.original_question: While preparing the results of English of a class, the marks of one student got recorded as 95 in place of 57, as a result of which there was an increase in the average score by 0.95. How many students were there in the class?

english.explanation: The difference between the incorrect and correct marks is 95 - 57 = 38. This error caused the average to increase by 0.95. Since the average increases by the error divided by the number of students, we set up the equation 38 / n = 0.95. Solving for n gives n = 38 / 0.95 = 40. Thus, there are 40 students in the class.
key_concepts: Impact of Data Errors on Averages

hindi.explanation: छात्र के अंक 57 के बजाय 95 दर्ज कर दिए गए, जिससे कुल अंकों में 95 - 57 = 38 की वृद्धि हुई। औसत में 0.95 की वृद्धि होने का अर्थ है कि कुल अंकों में 0.95 × n की वृद्धि हुई (जहां n छात्रों की संख्या है)। इसलिए 38 = 0.95 × n, जिसे हल करने पर n = 38 / 0.95 = 40 आता है।
key_concepts: औसत की गणना (कुल अंकों का छात्रों की संख्या से भाग देना)
अंकों में त्रुटि से कुल अंकों और औसत में परिवर्तन
समीकरण बनाकर अज्ञात मान ज्ञात करना

questions.original_question: A person bought a book at 31% discount on its printed price. If no discount was given, then he would have to pay Rs. 2,480 more. How much did he pay (in Rs.) for the book?

english.explanation: Let the printed price (original price) be Rs. P. A 31% discount means the person paid 69% of P (100% - 31%). The difference between the original price and the discounted price is Rs. 2,480. This gives the equation: P - 0.69P = 2,480 → 0.31P = 2,480 → P = 8,000. The amount paid is 69% of 8,000 = 0.69 × 8,000 = Rs. 5,520.
key_concepts: Discount formulas (Discount = Marked Price × Discount Rate)

hindi.explanation: माना पुस्तक का अंकित मूल्य MP है। 31% की छूट के बाद व्यक्ति द्वारा भुगतान की गई राशि = MP × (1 - 0.31) = 0.69MP। जब कोई छूट नहीं है तो मूल्य MP होता है। अंतर 2,480 रुपये है, इसलिए MP - 0.69MP = 0.31MP = 2,480। इससे MP = 2,480 ÷ 0.31 = 8,000। व्यक्ति द्वारा भुगतान की गई वास्तविक राशि = 0.69 × 8,000 = 5,520 रुपये।
hindi.key_concepts: 1. छूट की गणना, 2. अंकित मूल्य से बिक्री मूल्य का संबंध, 3. प्रतिशतता के आधार पर मूल्य अंतर का विश्लेषण।

questions.original_question: PQRS is a cyclic quadrilateral and PQ is a diameter of the circle. If &ang;RPQ = 23&deg;, then what is the measure of &ang;PSR?

english.explanation: Since PQ is the diameter, triangle PQR is right-angled at R. Angle RPQ = 23°, so angle PQR = 90° - 23° = 67°. In cyclic quadrilateral PQRS, opposite angles are supplementary. Thus, angle PSR = 180° - angle PQR = 180° - 67° = 113°.

hindi.explanation: चक्रीय चतुर्भुज PQRS में PQ व्यास है। अतः त्रिभुज PRQ समकोणीय होगा (व्यास के सिरों पर बनने वाला कोण 90° होता है)। दिया गया है कि ∠RPQ = 23°, इसलिए त्रिभुज PRQ में ∠RQP = 67° (क्योंकि 90° - 23° = 67°)। चक्रीय चतुर्भुज में विपरीत कोण संपूरक होते हैं। इसलिए, ∠PSR = 180° - ∠RQP = 180° - 67° = 113°।

questions.original_question: If 5<span class="math-tex">\(\sqrt{3}\)</span> +&nbsp;<span class="math-tex">\(\sqrt{75}\)</span> = 17.32, then the value of 14<span class="math-tex">\(\sqrt{3}\)</span> +&nbsp;<span class="math-tex">\(\sqrt{108}\)</span> is:
Three partners shared the profit in a business in the proportion of 9 ∶ 8 ∶ 11. They invested their capitals for 4 months, 6 months and 18 months, respectively. What was the ratio of their capitals?

english.explanation: Profit ratio (9:8:11) divided by time (4,6,18) gives capitals ratio: (9/4) : (8/6) : (11/18). Multiply by LCM of denominators (36) to get 81:48:22.

questions.original_question: An article is sold at a certain price. If it is sold at 70% of this price, then there is a loss of 10%. What is the percentage profit, when it is sold at the original selling price?

english.explanation: Let cost price = CP. 0.7SP = 0.9CP ⇒ SP = (0.9/0.7)CP. Profit at SP: (SP - CP)/CP *100 = (2/7)*100 = 200/7%.

questions.original_question: Which of the following is the smallest number that is a perfect square and is divisible by each of the numbers 6, 8 and 15?

english.explanation: LCM of 6,8,15 is 120. To make a perfect square, multiply by 2*3*5 to get 2^4*3^2*5^2 = 3600.

hindi.explanation: 6, 8, 15 का LCM = 120 है। सबसे छोटी पूर्ण वर्ग संख्या 120 के गुणक होगी। 120 के अभाज्य गुणननखंड = 2³ × 3 × 5। पूर्ण वर्ग बनाने के लिए सभी घात सम होनी चाहिए। 120 को 2 × 3 × 5 = 30 से गुणा करेंगे। इसलिए, 120 × 30 = 3600 (60²)।

questions.original_question: If (4a - 3b) = 1, ab = <span class="math-tex">\(\frac{1}{2}\)</span>, where a &gt; 0 and b &gt; 0, what is the value of (64a<sup>3</sup> + 27b<sup>3</sup>)?

english.explanation: Solve 4a - 3b = 1 and ab = 1/2. Substitute b = 1/(2a) into the first equation, solve quadratic to find a = 3/4, b = 2/3. Compute 64a³ + 27b³ = 27 + 8 = 35.

questions.original_question: If a + b + c = 6, a<sup>2</sup> + b<sup>2</sup> + c<sup>2</sup> = 32, and a<sup>3</sup> + b<sup>3</sup> + c<sup>3</sup> = 189, then the value of 4abc is:

english.explanation: Use identity: a³ + b³ + c³ - 3abc = (a + b + c)(a² + b² + c² - ab - bc - ca). Compute ab + bc + ca = 2. Substitute values to find abc = 3 ⇒ 4abc = 12.

hindi.explanation: दिया गया है: a + b + c = 6, a² + b² + c² = 32, a³ + b³ + c³ = 189। सूत्र: (a + b + c)² = a² + b² + c² + 2(ab + bc + ca)। 6² = 32 + 2(ab + bc + ca) ⇒ ab + bc + ca = 2। a³ + b³ + c³ = (a + b + c)³ - 3(a + b + c)(ab + bc + ca) + 3abc ⇒ 189 = 216 - 36 + 3abc ⇒ 3abc = 9 ⇒ abc = 3 ⇒ 4abc = 12।

questions.original_question: A is 25% more than B, and B is 40% less than C. If C is 20% more than D, then A is what percentage less than D?

english.explanation: Express A, B, C, D in terms: A = 0.9D. Thus, A is 10% less than D.

questions.original_question: The distance between two towns is covered in 7 hours at a speed of 50 km/h. By how much should the speed (in km/h) be increased so that 2 hours of travelling time will be saved?

english.explanation: Distance = 50*7 = 350 km. New speed = 350/5 = 70 km/h. Increase = 70 - 50 = 20 km/h.
Calculate average cars per hour from 7 am to 12 noon. Compare each hour's count to the average to identify periods with fewer cars.

questions.original_question:
<p><strong>The following sentence has been split into four segments. Identify the segment that contains a grammatical error.</strong></p>

<p>We bought / two dozens / mangoes from / the market.</p>

english.explanation: The phrase 'two dozens' is grammatically incorrect. 'Dozen' is a singular noun, and when used with a number, it should remain in the singular form. The correct expression is 'two dozen'.

english.explanation: 'Ravenous' means extremely hungry or eager. 'Starved' is the closest synonym, while 'Content,' 'Satiated,' and 'Full' imply the opposite state of being satisfied.

questions.original_question:
<p><strong>Select the option that expresses the given sentence in active voice.</strong></p>

<p>He is given proper guidance by his boss.</p>

options.value: His boss has been giving him proper guidance.
He gives proper guidance to his boss.
His boss gives him proper guidance.
His boss is giving him proper guidance.

english.correct_answer: 3. His boss gives him proper guidance.
english.explanation: The passive sentence 'He is given proper guidance by his boss' becomes active when the subject (his boss) performs the action. The correct active voice is in option 3, which uses the present simple tense.

questions.original_question:
<p><strong>Select the most appropriate synonym of the given word.</strong></p>

english.explanation: 'Lull' refers to a period of inactivity or calm. 'Activity,' 'Disturbance,' and 'Noise' are antonyms and do not align with the meaning of 'Calm.'

questions.original_question:
<p><strong>Select the most appropriate option to substitute the underlined segment in the given sentence. If there is no need to substitute it, select &lsquo;No substitution required&rsquo;.</strong></p>

<p>It is quite difficult to <u>make on</u> what this doctor writes.</p>

english.explanation: The phrase 'make on' is incorrect. The correct phrase is 'make out,' which means to understand or decipher. 'Make in' and 'made on' are grammatically invalid in this context.

questions.original_question:
<p><strong>The following sentence has been split into four segments. Identify the segment that contains a grammatical error.</strong></p>

<p>My friend / who&rsquo;s leg / was fractured, / has recovered.</p>

english.explanation: 'Who’s leg' is grammatically incorrect. 'Who’s' is a contraction of 'who is,' but the sentence requires the possessive form 'whose' to indicate ownership (whose leg was fractured).

questions.original_question:
<p><strong>The following sentence has been split into four segments. Identify the segment that contains a grammatical error.</strong></p>

<p>Will you / care for / a cup of / hot coffee?</p>

english.explanation: 'Care for' is a correct phrasal verb meaning 'want to have or do something.' The sentence is grammatically correct, but the question may be designed to test recognition of phrasal verbs.

questions.original_question:
<p><strong>Select the option that expresses the given sentence in direct speech.</strong></p>

english.explanation: The exclamation 'Alas!' and the present perfect tense 'has become' correctly convey the sorrowful expression. Direct speech requires reporting the speaker's exact words and emotional tone.
